intro: Phaulanthus stipularis, commonly known as the stipular phaulanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are alternate and often have a stipular structure, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
